title: Bomb explodes at police officer's home as ATO approach | UTV - ITV News
text:
22 February 2017 at 5:02pm Bomb explodes at police officer's home as ATO approach Police and army bomb experts at the scene where a viable bomb exploded at a police officer's home in Londonderry. Credit: Presseye 
A booby-trap bomb which is believed to have fallen from a police officerâ€™s car has exploded as army bomb experts approached it. 
No-one was injured when the device detonated in the driveway of the officer's home at Ardanlee in the Culmore area of Londonderry on Wednesday afternoon. 
It is understood the bomb was lying on the driveway, having fallen off the policeman's vehicle as he drove away from home earlier in the morning. 
District commander Superintendent Gordon McCalmont said at a police press conference: "Shortly after 9.30 this morning we were made aware of a suspect device of one of my colleagues in Ardanlee off the Culmore Road in the city here. We immediately took steps to ensure the safety of the community resulting in 12 families being evacuated from their homes. 
"My colleagues in testament to them, as they were working on the suspect device, the device exploded, making it our assessment that that is a viable device left at the home of one of my colleagues." WATCH: Explosion heard as viable bomb goes off at police officer's home in Derry.
